value.name: Creator
value.description: Party that created the investigation case.

value.name: Reopen Case Indication
value.description: Indicates whether or not the case was previously closed and is now re-opened.

value.name: Case
value.description: Identifies the investigation case.

value.name: Original Message Identification
value.description: Point to point reference, as assigned by the original instructing party, to unambiguously identify the original message.

value.name: Original Message Name Identification
value.description: Specifies the original message name identifier to which the message refers.

value.name: Original Creation Date Time
value.description: Date and time at which the original message was created.

value.name: Original Message Delivery Channel
value.description: Original channel used for the delivery of the message, to allow the receiver of the request to locate the payment with greater ease.

value.name: Original Group Information
value.description: Set of elements used to provide information on the original message.

value.name: Original Payment Information Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the original sending party, to unambiguously identify the original payment information group.

value.name: Original Instruction Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the original instructing party for the original instructed party, to unambiguously identify the original instruction.

value.name: Original End To End Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the original initiating party, to unambiguously identify the original transaction.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Original Instructed Amount
value.description: Amount of money, as provided in the original transaction, to be moved between the debtor and the creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency, as ordered by the original initiating party.

value.name: Date
value.description: Specified date.

value.name: Date Time
value.description: Specified date and time.

value.name: Requested Execution Date
value.description: Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment.  Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.

value.name: Requested Collection Date
value.description: Date at which the creditor requests the amount of money to be collected from the debtor.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Interbank Settlement Amount
value.description: Amount of money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Instructed Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party. Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and to be moved in a different currency. Usage: The first agent will convert the equivalent amount into the amount to be moved.

value.name: Currency Of Transfer
value.description: Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account.

value.name: Equivalent Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.

value.name: Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.

value.name: Interbank Settlement Date
value.description: Date on which the amount of money ceases to be available to the agent that owes it and when the amount of money becomes available to the agent to which it is due.

value.name: Requested Collection Date
value.description: Date and time at which the creditor requests that the amount of money is to be collected from the debtor.

value.name: Date
value.description: Specified date.

value.name: Reference
value.description: Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.

value.name: Currency
value.description: Identification of the currency in which the account is held.  Usage: Currency should only be used in case one and the same account number covers several currencies and the initiating party needs to identify which currency needs to be used for settlement on the account.

value.name: Name
value.description: Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution, in agreement with the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account. Usage: The account name is different from the account owner name. The account name is used in certain user communities to provide a means of identifying the account, in addition to the account owner's identity and the account number.

value.name: Purpose
value.description: Underlying reason for the payment transaction. Usage:  Purpose is used by the end customers, that is initiating party, (ultimate) debtor, (ultimate) creditor to provide information concerning the nature of the payment. Purpose is a content element, which is not used for processing by any of the agents involved in the payment chain.

value.name: Original Transaction Reference
value.description: Key elements used to identify the original transaction that is being referred to.

value.name: Initiation
value.description: Set of elements used to reference the details of the original payment initiation.

value.name: Original Message Identification
value.description: Point to point reference, as assigned by the original instructing party, to unambiguously identify the original message.

value.name: Original Message Name Identification
value.description: Specifies the original message name identifier to which the message refers.

value.name: Original Creation Date Time
value.description: Date and time at which the original message was created.

value.name: Original Message Delivery Channel
value.description: Original channel used for the delivery of the message, to allow the receiver of the request to locate the payment with greater ease.

value.name: Original Group Information
value.description: Set of elements used to provide information on the original message.

value.name: Original Instruction Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the original instructing party for the original instructed party, to unambiguously identify the original instruction.

value.name: Original End To End Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the original initiating party, to unambiguously identify the original transaction.

value.name: Original Transaction Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the original first instructing agent, to unambiguously identify the transaction.

value.name: Original Interbank Settlement Amount
value.description: Amount of money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent, as provided in the original instruction.

value.name: Original Interbank Settlement Date
value.description: Date, as provided in the original transaction, on which the amount of money ceases to be available to the agent that owes it and when the amount of money becomes available to the agent to which it is due.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Interbank Settlement Amount
value.description: Amount of money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Instructed Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party. Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and to be moved in a different currency. Usage: The first agent will convert the equivalent amount into the amount to be moved.

value.name: Currency Of Transfer
value.description: Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account.

value.name: Equivalent Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.

value.name: Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.

value.name: Interbank Settlement Date
value.description: Date on which the amount of money ceases to be available to the agent that owes it and when the amount of money becomes available to the agent to which it is due.

value.name: Requested Collection Date
value.description: Date and time at which the creditor requests that the amount of money is to be collected from the debtor.

value.name: Date
value.description: Specified date.

value.name: Date Time
value.description: Specified date and time.

value.name: Requested Execution Date
value.description: Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment.  Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.

value.name: Code
value.description: Account type, in a coded form.

value.description: Nature or use of the account in a proprietary form.

value.name: Type
value.description: Specifies the nature, or use of the account.

value.name: Currency
value.description: Identification of the currency in which the account is held.  Usage: Currency should only be used in case one and the same account number covers several currencies and the initiating party needs to identify which currency needs to be used for settlement on the account.

value.name: Name
value.description: Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution, in agreement with the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account. Usage: The account name is different from the account owner name. The account name is used in certain user communities to provide a means of identifying the account, in addition to the account owner's identity and the account number.

value.name: Reference
value.description: Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.

value.description: Ultimate party to which an amount of money is due.

value.name: Code
value.description: Underlying reason for the payment transaction, as published in an external purpose code list.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Purpose, in a proprietary form.

value.name: Purpose
value.description: Underlying reason for the payment transaction. Usage:  Purpose is used by the end customers, that is initiating party, (ultimate) debtor, (ultimate) creditor to provide information concerning the nature of the payment. Purpose is a content element, which is not used for processing by any of the agents involved in the payment chain.

value.name: Original Transaction Reference
value.description: Key elements used to identify the original transaction that is being referred to.

value.name: Interbank
value.description: Set of elements used to reference the details of the original interbank payment transaction.

value.name: Original Message Identification
value.description: Point to point reference assigned by the original instructing party to unambiguously identify the original message.

value.name: Original Message Name Identification
value.description: Specifies the original message name identifier to which the message refers, for example, pacs.003.001.01 or MT103.

value.name: Original Creation Date Time
value.description: Original date and time at which the message was created.

value.name: Original Group Information
value.description: Set of elements used to provide information on the original message.

value.name: Original Statement Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the account servicer, to unambiguously identify the original statement.

value.name: Original Entry Identification
value.description: Original unique identification, as assigned by the account servicer, to unambiguously identify the original entry.

value.name: Statement Entry
value.description: Reference details on the underlying statement cash entry.

value.name: Underlying
value.description: Identifies the payment transaction to be modified.

value.name: Instruction Identification
value.description: Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction. Usage: The instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

value.name: End To End Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the initiating party, to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.

value.name: Transaction Identification
value.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the first instructing agent, to unambiguously identify the transaction that is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire interbank chain.  Usage: The transaction identification can be used for reconciliation, tracking or to link tasks relating to the transaction on the interbank level. The instructing agent has to make sure that the transaction identification is unique for a pre-agreed period.

value.name: Instruction Priority
value.description: Indicator of the urgency or order of importance that the instructing party would like the instructed party to apply to the processing of the instruction.

value.name: Clearing Channel
value.description: Specifies the clearing channel to be used to process the payment instruction.

value.name: Code
value.description: Specifies a pre-agreed service or level of service between the parties, as published in an external service level code list.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Specifies a pre-agreed service or level of service between the parties, as a proprietary code.

value.name: Service Level
value.description: Agreement under which or rules under which the transaction should be processed.

value.name: Code
value.description: Specifies the local instrument, as published in an external local instrument code list.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Specifies the local instrument, as a proprietary code.

value.name: Local Instrument
value.description: User community specific instrument. Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level.

value.name: Sequence Type
value.description: Identifies the direct debit sequence, such as first, recurrent, final or one-off.

value.name: Code
value.description: Category purpose, as published in an external category purpose code list.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Category purpose, in a proprietary form.

value.name: Category Purpose
value.description: Specifies the high level purpose of the instruction based on a set of pre-defined categories. Usage: This is used by the initiating party to provide information concerning the processing of the payment. It is likely to trigger special processing by any of the agents involved in the payment chain.

value.name: Payment Type Information
value.description: Set of elements used to further specify the type of transaction.

value.name: Date
value.description: Specified date.

value.name: Date Time
value.description: Specified date and time.

value.name: Requested Execution Date
value.description: Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment.  Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.

value.name: Requested Collection Date
value.description: Date and time at which the creditor requests that the amount of money is to be collected from the debtor.

value.name: Interbank Settlement Date
value.description: Date on which the amount of money ceases to be available to the agent that owes it and when the amount of money becomes available to the agent to which it is due.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Instructed Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party. Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and to be moved in a different currency. Usage: The first agent will convert the equivalent amount into the amount to be moved.

value.name: Currency Of Transfer
value.description: Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account.

value.name: Equivalent Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.

value.name: Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.

value.name: Xml Attribute Currency
value.description: Medium of exchange of currency.

value.name: Interbank Settlement Amount
value.description: Amount of money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent.

value.name: Reference
value.description: Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.
